intro: Passerina metnan, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, yellowish-green inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and marshy areas. Its flowers are usually arranged in spikes and bloom during the spring and early summer. Passerina metnan plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native environment.
